sentence.Network_en: He met a crabbed, cantankerous director.
sentence.Network_cn: 他碰上了一位坏脾气、爱争吵的主管。

sentence.Network_en: He was nothing but a narrow, ignorant, and cantankerous sea -- faring man .
sentence.Network_cn: 他只不过是个狭隘无知 、 脾气 暴戾 的海员而已.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 住巴黎，毁三观 - FT速读测试 - FT中文网 ... faux pas （法）失礼，失态 cantankerous 脾气坏的；难相处的 hoot 喊叫；鸣响.
GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... cant n． 隐语，术语 cantankerous adj． 脾气坏的，好争吵的 cantata n． 清唱剧.
爱嘲笑地 cynically爱吵架的 cantankerous爱吵闹的 currish

list.abs: 美国大学翻译中文 3 - geovindu的日志 -... ... 不快 unhappy 不怀好意地 cantankerously 不怕 fearless.
...cant over 倾斜翻转can't 不能不会cantankerous 爱争吵脾气坏cantankerously cantaloup 甜瓜皱皮瓜cantaloupe cantata 康塔塔大合唱canteen 食堂饭堂饭盒水壶小卖部.
an argumentative discourse argumentative to the point of being cantankerous ; an intelligent but argumentative child ., 与人争辩的演讲 ; 爱与人争辩到了刚愎自用的程度 ; 一个聪明但爱与人争辩的小孩.

means.word_mean: 易怒的;卑鄙的;好打架的

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 18th cent.: of unknown origin; perhaps a blend of Anglo-Irish cant 'auction' and rancorous (see rancour)

entry.def: Someone who is cantankerous is always finding things to argue or complain about.

means.word_mean: 1. stubbornly obstructive and unwilling to cooperate;

sentences.sentence: "unions...have never been as bloody-minded about demarcation as the shipbuilders"- Spectator

means.word_mean: 2. having a difficult and contrary disposition;

sentences.sentence: "a cantankerous and venomous-tongued old lady"- Dorothy Sayers
